posts._title: Mikio Naruse – Uwasa no musume aka The Girl in the Rumor (1935)
posts.title: Uwasa no musume
posts.excerpt: Quote:A story of two sisters, the older being more traditional, the younger a “moga” (“modern girl”). Their widowed father runs the family sake shop — but is running into financial trouble (causing him to make some bad decisions). Meanwhile, his long-time mistress’s little business is also on the rocks. Amidst this, the older sister is …

posts.title: Don’t Look Now
posts.excerpt: Quote:Don’t Look Now is a 1973 occult thriller film directed by Nicolas Roeg. Julie Christie and Donald Sutherland star as a married couple whose lives become complicated after meeting two elderly sisters in Venice, one of whom claims to be clairvoyant and informs them that their recently deceased daughter is trying to contact them to …

posts._title: Ishirô Honda – Gasu ningen dai ichigo AKA The Human Vapor (1960)
posts.title: Gasu ningen dai ichigo
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:A librarian is subject to a scientific experiment which goes wrong and transforms him into ‘The Human Vapour’. He uses his new ability to rob banks to fund the career of his girlfriend, a beautiful dancer. The Human Vapour is ruthless in his quest for money and kills anyone who stands in his way, especially …

posts._title: David Achkar – Allah Tantou AKA God’s Will (1992)
posts.title: Allah Tantou
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:‘Allah Tantou’ is the first African film to confront the immense personal and political costs of the continent’s widespread human rights abuses. Director David Achkar has described the origins of his film: “Every year Amnesty International publishes a list of countries where human rights are ignored, including the estimated number of those unjustly imprisoned and …

posts._title: Yoshihiko Matsui – Tonkei shinjû aka Pig-Chicken Suicide (1981)
posts.title: Tonkei shinjû
posts.excerpt: Directed by Japanese underground legend Yoshihiko Matsui, most famous for his epic film Noisy Requiem and his early work with maverik Japanese director Sogo Ishii (Gojoe, Crazy Thunder Road), Pig Chicken Suicide is a veritable assault on the senses, mixing violent images of animal slaughter, racial strife and surrealism to tell the story of two …

posts.title: Xime
posts.excerpt: The film tells the tale of Iala, whose authority over his two sons, Raul and Bedan, is shaken. Raul has left to study in a seminary in the big city, where unknown to anyone, he has joined the liberation movement. Meanwhile, younger son, Bedan is rebelling against every possible tradition, even eyeing his father’s young …

posts._title: Nadine Labaki – Et maintenant on va où? AKA Where Do We Go Now? (2011)
posts.title: Et maintenant on va où?
posts.excerpt: In an isolated Lebanese village, the mosque and the church stand side by side–but religious tension threatens to boil over, particularly as a series of pranks escalates into ever-increasing hostility. The women of the village, both Christian and Muslim, concoct improbable schemes to defuse the tension, including hiring a troupe of Ukrainian belly dancers. Where …

posts._title: Tai Katô – Edogawa Rampo no injû AKA Beast in the Shadows (1977)
posts.title: Edogawa Rampo no injû
